channel.title: Pages on David Triana
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on David Triana

item.title: MY BOOKS
item.author: david@davidtriana.com (David Triana)
item.description:
Updated 4-may-2015 / The read section is still incomplete

Wish list

Type

Title

Self Development

Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can’t Stop Talking

Technical

Agile Principles, Patterns, and Practices in C#

Currently reading

Type

Title

Management and leadership

The Tipping Point

Technical

Software in 30 Days: How Agile Managers Beat the Odds, Delight Their Customers, And Leave Competitors In the Dust

Read*

*Incomplete list, most of the technical books are missing at the moment

Type

Title

Comment

Management and leadership

Chess Not Checkers

Like a mini – Phoenix Project but for leadership and management, short and fun.

Management and leadership

[

The E-Myth Revisited

](http://www.amazon.com/E-Myth-Revisited-Michael-E-Gerber-ebook/dp/B000RO9VJK/ref=sr_1_1?s=digital-text&ie=UTF8&qid=1428973223&sr=1-1&keywords=the+e+myth)

Very good, lots of good tips and insights about  running a business. This book is not only about entrepreneurship but companies in general. 

History / Economics

Start-up Nation: The Story of Israel’s Economic Miracle

Good read, lots of interesting anecdotes and historic events to get a bit of understanding of this part of the world

SciFi

Influx

A must read, excellent book

Management and leadership

The Phoenix Project: A Novel About IT, DevOps, and Helping Your Business Win

Quite good, very funny picture of most of my customers

SciFi

The Martian: A Novel

If the novel prizes are still a thing the author of this book should get at least 5 of them for this book. Absolutely amazing

SciFi

Space Prison

Great history on a very interesting possible future

SciFi

Rogue Code: A Jeff Aiken Novel (Jeff Aiken Series Book 3)

The stakes keep getting higher for Jeff, and Mark’s style gets only better

Health

The Primal Blueprint: Reprogram your genes for effortless weight loss, vibrant health and boundless energy (Primal Blueprint Series)

Well written and researched health advice, quite good and VERY LONG!

SciFi

Ender’s Game (The Ender Quartet series Book 1)

So glad I read the book before the movie. The movie is crap, this book is absolutely amazing

SciFi

Operation Desolation: A Short Story (Jeff Aiken Series)

A short one but entertaining

SciFi

Kill Decision

Action packed SciFi triller, loved it

SciFi

Trojan Horse: A Jeff Aiken Novel (Jeff Aiken Series Book 2)

The timing for this book is almost uncomfortable, it’s like is not SciFi but current events

Technical / Management

Effective Programming: More Than Writing Code

A must read for everyone in the industry

SciFi

Dune

A classic! Very well narrated story.

Technical

The Pragmatic Programmer: From Journeyman to Master

Is there’s a bible for programmers, this is the one

SciFi

Lucifer’s Hammer

Ah, this post apocalyptic story really got me thinking about the what ifs of a catastrophic event, how to preserve the knowledge, the technology, and stay alive!

Health

Deadly Harvest: The Intimate Relationship Between Our Heath and Our Food

If you only read one book about health, this one will change your life

Business / Management

Rework

Nice short read, good advice

SciFi

Zero Day: A Jeff Aiken Novel (Jeff Aiken Series Book 1)

Looks like the beginning of an amazing zaga

Technical / Reference

Software Testing: An ISTQB-ISEB Foundation Guide

I just bought it to study for the certification exam, good information here however

SciFi

Foundation

A must read. The universe in this book is absolutely inspiring, loved it.

Politics

Confessions of an Economic Hit Man

An eye opener about the sad reality of our society

SciFi

Pandora’s Star (The Commonwealth Saga Book 1)

Very immersive SciFi, really puts your mind to spin with an amazing universe, very entertaining and inspiring

Health

Why We Get Fat: And What to Do About It

Very good information, however I liked more Deadly Harvest

SciFi

Freedom (TM) (Daemon Book 2)

This series is the best SciFi I have read. Sometimes looks more like reality than SciFi, a very scary reality

SciFi

Daemon

The best SciFi, period.

item.title: Podcasts
item.author: david@davidtriana.com (David Triana)
item.description:
This are the podcast i’m currently listening / viewing. If you don’t know what is a podcast i’m sure wikipedia explains it but basically are like radio / TV shows that i download to my computer and take with me on an iPod or other device to enjoy them where and when i like to.

I listen to the audio podcasts when i commute to my work and when i workout in the gym.

I watch the video podcasts at work in my lunch time. Since i don’t go out to take my lunch, i enjoy my MRP Shake in company of one or two shows.

Before i got my iPhone i consume the audiopodcast on a cellphone or an standard iPod and the videopodcasts on the laptop. Now with the iPhone i enjoy both flavors with the same device.

I’ve tried a couple replacements to iTunes but i keep coming back and with the iPhone there’s no options.

Cranky Geeks (Video)
Like diggnation but with cranks. Actually this show’s dynamic is a little different as the main host, John, invites very good co-hosts each show. The show is very funny.

Diggnation (Video)
This is the first podcast i subscribed to and until now never stoped downloading and enjoying. This guys are very funny and when i hear them talking is like they are my friends.

DL.TV (Video)
Not the same since Patrick left, but still good. This is another tech show, they review products, show how to do things, recommend software and answer technical questions.

Formulapod
After the races and some qualis, this guys make me laught a lot with their funny comments about Ralf, Culthard, Hami and all the stuff that happens in Formula 1.

Security Now
Steve Gibson knows what he is talking about. Security is his field and he talks about networks, windows, the web, passwords, PINs. Very good, very up to date, very technical when needed.

The totally rad show (Video)
About all the things RAD. They talk about the latest movies, games, tv shows, sometimes books, sometimes comics. The show is a little long so i generally skip the latest section (mail, forums, others) but i really enjoy their movies and games reviews.

This week in science
Latest news in science, commented by the brillant Dr. Kirsten and the funny Justin. Very good interviews also.

This week in tech
Tech news commented by the best guys in town. Fun, informative, dynamic … , love it.

Tikibar (Video)
This one is really hard to explain. You need to check it out by yourself. The thruth is i’m still trying to understand it.

Windows Weekly
The latests in the Microsoft land, but this guys talk about everything, even Mac!!!, i love their points of view, their experiences with operating systems, gaming consoles and devices in general.
